text: The NSW premier will move to reinstate a controversial 'festival safety system' after coming under pressure to allow pill testing. Gladys Berejiklian will reintroduce legislation to state parliament, which would force organisers to prepare safety management plans for high-risk events. Under the plan, a licensing fee would be waived for low-risk festivals but others would be forced to pay-up and cover the costs of police and paramedics who are called-in to help. The premier is also rejecting a push from the deputy state coroner to introduce pill-testing to prevent drug-related deaths. Image: News Corp Australia
